bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, May 27, 1897

div1.p: Sweitzer cancels her visit to Baltimore, but Lazear is anxious to meet her in New York before she leaves for Canada.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, May 27, 1897
div1.p:
I was
very sorry to learn
today that you had
finally decided not
not to come.

We had fully expected
you and have a
very good servant.

It is very kind
of you to send the
check. I am very
much afraid you
are stealing yourself.

I shall not need
all of it so there
will be a balance
in the bank.

The letter I wrote
to you last Sunday
came here today and
I will forward it
with others that have
come for you.

If you are going to stay in
New York over Saturday, I may
go up there on that day.

I am very anxious to see you
before you go to Canada.

I cannot go tomorrow Friday as
I have a class in the
afternoon.

I hope to get a letter
from you in the morning
